description:
SurveyMonkey is a global leader in online surveys and forms that empowers people with the insights they need to make decisions with speed and confidence. Our fast, intuitive feedback management platform connects millions of users worldwide with real-time AI-powered insights that drive meaningful decisions. We provide answers to more than 20 million questions every day so that people and organizations can attract new audiences, delight customers, create advocates, and extend their competitive advantage in the marketplace. Our vision is to raise the bar for human experiences by amplifying individual voices. Learn more at surveymonkey.com.
 
  More about our Strategic Planning & Analysis Team 
  We are a dynamic team of former investment bankers, data analysts, and technology finance professionals who enjoy solving the challenges that come with rapid scaling. Our mission is to bring people together by using data and insights to guide decisions and promote outcomes that maximize stakeholder value. 
  What we're looking for 
  We're looking for a professional to influence decisions and shape outcomes at speed. You are innately curious, love to synthesize data into actionable insights, and are passionate about driving automation. In this highly visible role, you will partner with senior leaders across the R&D organization and be the key strategic finance partner to support operational and financial planning, business analysis, and decision-making. You will also assume a pivotal role in overseeing the full consolidated P&L while actively contributing to achieving the company's target financial objectives/profile. 
  What you'll be working on 
  
  Embed with the business and provide strategic finance partnerships to senior leaders across the R&D organization 
  Own significant responsibility in financial planning/forecasting (current quarter, current year, multi-year) for the R&D organization, looking for and driving ways to improve accuracy and efficiency 
  Provide concise reporting and analysis to partners, ensuring drivers, issues, and required actions are understood 
  Partner with the R&D department leadership to drive strategic resource allocation decisions 
  Provide regular analysis and insights that improve our strategy and operational plans 
  Help drive the SurveyMonkey consolidated P&L forecasts, annual financial planning process, and monthly/quarterly reporting to our executives and Board of Directors 
  
 We'd love to hear from people with 
  
  You have 5-7+ years of Finance related roles (investment banking, management consulting, FPA, or finance operations) 
  You pride yourself on your spreadsheet skills and ability to create robust models from large datasets to reach actionable conclusions 
  You can translate complex concepts into simple takeaways and are not hesitant to voice your point of view 
  You excel at solving problems, identifying the people and information you need, structuring the analysis, and connecting the dots to tell a compelling story 
  You are passionate about taking something good and making it great 
  Team environments are your jam; you leave your attitude and ego at the door 
  Completing projects from end to end excites you 
  You are curious and want to learn more about SaaS business models and metrics 
  
 #LI-remote
 
   Why SurveyMonkey? We're glad you asked 
   SurveyMonkey is a place where the curious come to grow. We're building an inclusive workplace where people of every background can excel no matter their time zone. At SurveyMonkey, we weave employee feedback into everything we do to create forward-looking benefits policies, employee programs, and an award-winning culture, including best workplace for parents, our annual holiday refresh, our annual week of service, and our C.H.O.I.C.E Fund. In addition, we've reimagined the way we work to allow employees to choose what works best for them - working in-person, fully remote, or a hybrid model that combines the two through our Choice Model. 
   Our commitment to an inclusive workplace 
   SurveyMonkey is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We celebrate the unique differences of our employees because that is what drives curiosity, innovation, and the success of our business. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, pregnancy, parental status, genetic information, political affiliation, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities.
